results.title: The Micallef programme [Series 2: episodes 1 - 3]
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Shaun Micallef, Gary McCaffrie and Ted Emery
results.brief_description: Lawyer turned comedian Shaun Micallef presents his own unique brand of humor in a series of sketches from his program along with fellow comedians Francis Greenslade, Wayne Hope and Roz Hammond. Items from three separate episodes include; Bud Smallhorn, passionate flag maker at the Old Glory Banner Company; Sexpo; Mark Wainwright, blind climber of Mt Everest; the politeness distance indicator; District Attorney Ferguson; Australia’s first male Miss Nude Australia; police corruption; farewelling a valued audience member; Dracula who wants to escape the rat race; meals on wheels; the search for the best laundry detergent and the Australian record domino attempt. Guests/special appearances by Tim Rogers, Kevin Harrington and Glenn Robbins.

results.title: The Metamorphosis of Mr Samsa
results.brief_description: Inspired by Franz Kafka’s short story of alienation and grief Metamorphosis, this animated film communicates through images of sand and sound what Kafka expressed through words. Simple materials are used with subtlety and precision to create the sad plight of human angst. From ordinary beach sand spread on a piece of glass, Caroline Leaf produces the tragic world of Gregor Samsa, half man. half insect.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.brief_description: Jeanette MacDonald is Sonia, a bubbly widow who owns over half the property of the tiny European country of Marshovia. When she relocates to glittery Paris, suave ladies’ man Captain Danilo, (Maurice Chevalier), pursues her. His mission: avert his homeland’s financial ruin by bringing Sonia back on the wings of love. A frothy high-spirited gem based on Frank Lehar’s operetta with the magical Lubitsch touch of wit and style.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Curtis Bernhardt
results.brief_description: Based on the operetta by Franz Lehar, libretto by Victor Leon and Leo Stein, this film adaptation stars Lana Turner as the “merry widow” supported by Thomas Gomez as the King of Marshovia and Fernando Lamas as the young Count Danilo. Oscar nominated for Best Art Direction/Set Decoration and Best Costumes. Cast also includes Una Merkel, Richard Haydn.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Opera Australia and Virginia Lumsden
results.brief_description: This performance, sung in English, of Franz Lehar’s “The Merry Widow” was recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, February 23, 1988. The Baron Zeta attempts to obtain the Merry Widow Hanna Glawaris’ fortune for his impoverished country of Pontevedria by getting his companion Danilo to marry her. The sub plot deals with the flirtation between Valencienne, Zeta’s young wife and Camille, an officer. Features Joan Sutherland, Ronald Stevens and the Australian Opera Chorus. The performance is directed by Lofti Mansouri. Richard Bonynge conducts the Elizabethan Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: The Merry mishaps of Mr. Bean
results.brief_description: Two more episodes in the adventures of the socially inept Mr. Bean. “Merry Christmas Mr. Bean” gives real meaning to the saying that Christmas shopping is a nightmare. In “Mr. Bean in room 426” the great rubber-faced one makes himself at home in a hotel room and is caught with his pants down (literally!). Watch for a cameo appearance by Danny La Rue and hear the great impersonator speak as you have never heard him before.
